uk.co.xfactorylibrarians.coremidi4j

Class CoreMidiClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.co.xfactorylibrarians.coremidi4j.CoreMidiClient

  • public class CoreMidiClient
extends Object
    CoreMidiClient class

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private AtomicInteger callbackCount
      Used to count the number of CoreMidi environment change callbacks we have received, so that if additional ones come in while we are delivering callback messages to our listeners, we know to start another round at the end.
      private int midiClientReference 
      private CoreMidiNotification mostRecentDeviceProvider
      Keeps track of the latest CoreMidiDeviceProvider added to our listener list; this is the only one that we want to call when the MIDI environment changes, since we only need to update the device map once, and Java creates a vast number of instances of our device provider.
      private Set<CoreMidiNotification> notificationListeners 
      private AtomicBoolean runningCallbacks
      The message callback for receiving notifications about changes in the MIDI environment from the JNI code.

      private void deliverCallbackToListeners()
      Check whether we are already in the process of delivering callbacks to our listeners; if not, start a background thread to do so, and at the end of that process, see if additional callbacks were attempted while it was going on.

    • Field Detail

      • midiClientReference

        private final int midiClientReference

      • notificationListeners

        private final Set<CoreMidiNotification> notificationListeners

      • mostRecentDeviceProvider

        private CoreMidiNotification mostRecentDeviceProvider
        Keeps track of the latest CoreMidiDeviceProvider added to our listener list; this is the only one that we want to call when the MIDI environment changes, since we only need to update the device map once, and Java creates a vast number of instances of our device provider.

      • runningCallbacks

        private final AtomicBoolean runningCallbacks
        The message callback for receiving notifications about changes in the MIDI environment from the JNI code.

        A reference to this method is created by the C++ method Java_uk_co_xfactorylibrarians_coremidi4j_CoreMidiClient_createClient which in turn is called by createClient(String).

        Used to make sure we are only running one callback delivery loop at a time without having to serialize the process in a way that will block the actual CoreMidi callback.

      • callbackCount

        private final AtomicInteger callbackCount
        Used to count the number of CoreMidi environment change callbacks we have received, so that if additional ones come in while we are delivering callback messages to our listeners, we know to start another round at the end.

      • deliverCallbackToListeners

        private void deliverCallbackToListeners()
        Check whether we are already in the process of delivering callbacks to our listeners; if not, start a background thread to do so, and at the end of that process, see if additional callbacks were attempted while it was going on.

      • notifyCallback

        public void notifyCallback()
                    throws CoreMidiException
        The message callback for receiving notifications about changes in the MIDI environment from the JNI code
        Throws:
        CoreMidiException - if a problem occurs passing along the notification

                  throws CoreMidiException
        Creates the MIDI Client
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Disposes of a CoreMIDI Client
